intro: Fuirena simplex var. aristulata, commonly known as the slender lily, is a rare and elegant flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is characterized by its slender, upright stems and delicate, white to pale pink flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves that are typically arranged in a rosette at the base. It thrives in well-drained soils and requires full sun to partial shade for optimal growth. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
